text:
Grand Street, north side, east from Mangin Street, to and including the East River; Williamsburg Bridge in the background.

April 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Grand Street, north side, at Mangin Street. Also shown is Mangin Street, east side, north from and including Grand Street. Note the Williamsburg Bridge spanning Mangin Street.

July 22, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Grand Street, north side, east from Mangin Street, to the East River. Note the Williamsburg Bridge, spanning the East River to Brooklyn.

July 22, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a different angle.

July 22, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing a closer view of construction at the N.E. corner of Tompkins Street.

July 22, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Grand Street, north side, east from Mangin Street, to the East River. Note the Williamsburg Bridge, spanning the East River to Brooklyn.

July 22, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a different angle.

July 22, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing a closer view of construction at the N.E. corner of Tompkins Street.

July 22, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Grand Street, north side, east from Mangin Street, to the East River. Note the Williamsburg Bridge, spanning the East River to Brooklyn.

July 22, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a different angle.

July 22, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing a closer view of construction at the N.E. corner of Tompkins Street.

July 22, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Mangin Street, north from Grand Street. Shown transversing the street at Delancey Street, is the Williamsburg Bridge.

February 12, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a view point slightly northward.
March 26, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Mangin Street, north from Grand Street. Shown transversing the street at Delancey Street, is the Williamsburg Bridge.

February 12, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a view point slightly northward.
March 26, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

Corlears Street, north from the East River to Grand St. At the left is Corlears Hook Park. The cleared site on the right is to provide for the new East River Drive link between South Street and that section above Grand Street. Several business buildings intervened and were removed. These included the Hecker and the Odora Bldgs. Since their demolition, an unobstructed view of the Williamsburg Bridge appears. The new roadway will pass under same and continus across a fill to the point from where the photographer is standing. The nondescript structures in the left background are on the far side of the park, Cherry Street.

April 7, 1940
1-2

P. L. Sperr

Corlears Street, north from the East River to Grand St. At the left is Corlears Hook Park. The cleared site on the right is to provide for the new East River Drive link between South Street and that section above Grand Street. Several business buildings intervened and were removed. These included the Hecker and the Odora Bldgs. Since their demolition, an unobstructed view of the Williamsburg Bridge appears. The new roadway will pass under same and continus across a fill to the point from where the photographer is standing. The nondescript structures in the left background are on the far side of the park, Cherry Street.

April 7, 1940
1-2

P. L. Sperr
